snippet: In a speech to a pro-Israel lobbying group, President Obama gave a forceful defense of his commitment to Israel’s security, taking on criticism from his Republican rivals.
abstract: President Obama, speaking before a pro-Israel lobbying group, warns against 'loose talk of war' that could serve to speed Iran toward a nuclear weapon; makes it clear that he does not believe that a strike on Iran would serve the interests of either the United States or Israel; also chides his Republican critics for putting politics ahead of American national security interests.

byline.contributor: Steven Lee Myers contributed reporting from Washington, and Ashley Parker from Snellville, Ga.

lead_paragraph: In a speech to a pro-Israel lobbying group, President Obama gave a forceful defense of his commitment to Israel’s security, taking on criticism from his Republican rivals.

headline.seo: Obama Tells Aipac He Won’t Tolerate a Nuclear Iran
headline.main: ‘Loose Talk of War’ Only Helps Iran, President Says
headline.print_headline: 'Loose' War Talk Only Helps Iran, President Says
